item.title: Running Postgres in Docker Container With Mounted Volume
item.description: Docker containers are stateless, meaning that once they stop running, they’ll lose any data generated after they started running. However if we’re using docker for a postgres database we’ll most likely want to keep our data. Theoretically, we could just never stop the docker container but issues outside of our control could happen such as crashes or power outages. We get around this problem by mounting a volume to our container and storing the data there.
